body_html:
I confirm it works for me too.

Just two questions:

  1. it's not clear to me why we need to run "${TOOLS_PATH}/autograd/gen_python_functions.py", as it seems to generate files that libtorch does not include;
  2. I'm wondering if we could make building torch/csrc/api/ optional at the CMake level; if you just need to execute the IR you don't necessarily need the cpp API and you can get away with a lighter / faster to build binary.
body_text:
I confirm it works for me too.
Just two questions:

it's not clear to me why we need to run "${TOOLS_PATH}/autograd/gen_python_functions.py", as it seems to generate files that libtorch does not include;
I'm wondering if we could make building torch/csrc/api/ optional at the CMake level; if you just need to execute the IR you don't necessarily need the cpp API and you can get away with a lighter / faster to build binary.
body:
I confirm it works for me too.

Just two questions:
1. it's not clear to me why we need to run `"${TOOLS_PATH}/autograd/gen_python_functions.py"`, as it seems to generate files that libtorch does not include;
2. I'm wondering if we could make building `torch/csrc/api/` optional at the CMake level; if you just need to execute the IR you don't necessarily need the cpp API and you can get away with a lighter / faster to build binary.
